page.title: 01General review of our area
page.content: { It is very largely farmland,either arable or pasture. It is low-lying, except for a low ridge running NE from Ambrosden called Blackthorn Hill. The SE part of our area contains the upper reaches of the River Ray. The area is divided by the A41 Aylesbury\Banbury road. The top section is almost entirely farmland. The lower section contains two villages called Ambrosden & Blackthorn. Ambrosden is the larger because of the army estates. It is an old village with a C12 (St Mary's Church, a Methodist Chapel & St Barbara's RC Church. Blackthorn is a 'U'-shaped village with several farms. The Chiltern Railway Line crosses the area NW\SE on an embankment,except for a short cutting through BlackthornHill. There is a large Army garrison with many installations operating an important Ordnance Depot.
